review.body: I think the writing style here really let down what could've been a very good short novel. At times it was impossible to tell who was speaking in a section of dialogue and the fact that different chapters were narrated by different characters in such a short book meant that you never really knew...
Ms. Marvel- quintessential teenage fangirl and all-round amazingly well-written (and drawn) superhero!

book.title: Los Hollister Y La Bruja Dorada

review.body: Los Hollister es la serie de libros que me inició definitivamente en la lectura. Recuerdo haber leído el primero y, con todo el dinero que había ahorrado por mi primera comunión y en todos los años anteriores, ir a por los 32 restantes, que costaban 600 pelas cada uno. Los compré todos en la fer...

book.title: A Pain in the Tuchis (A Mrs. Kaplan Mystery #2)

review.body: Who knew so much went on in a senior home? What fun to follow Ida’s account of Mrs. Kaplan’s adventures as they try to figure out if Vera Gold – not the most pleasant person – was murdered. It’s an enjoyable twist to Dr. Watson and Holmes.

When you don't know where to turn And your on the run with your best friend from people trying to capture you and take you back to the waste place ever. High school. But no normal high school, the vampire academy.
You will laugh, you will cry and you will think about the intensity of love. Wonderful story.

book.title: The Wing Wing Brothers Math Spectacular!

review.body: The five wacky Wing Wing brothers, Willy, Woody, Walter, Wilmer and Wendell take young readers through math exercises in the form of circus-like acts. They juggle plates and pies and hide in a wooden box via a series of activities designed to get youngsters interested and to understand addition a...

book.title: Perfume: The Story of a Murderer

review.body: I found this book gripping and interesting- the plot is definitely very unique! I was expecting more murders throughout the story but there was a one hundred page gap in the middle which was a bit disappointing, I felt like the second half was rushed due to this. The ending also didn't make much...

"The greatest surprise of The Dark Forest is its emphasis, amid spectacular set pieces and dollops of hard science, on ideas in conflict. Driving these conflicts is the overriding question, Given the certainty of the threat and the scales of space and time involved, what ought humanity, en masse...

After falling in love with her middle grade sci-fi/fantasy Black Lightning, I knew without a doubt that K.S. Jones could write exceptionally well. So when I learned that her debut novel Shadow of the Hawk had taken first place in the Chawcer Awards for historical fiction and had won a literary cl...

I really enjoyed this, definitely my favourite book written by Philippa Gregory (of the ones I've read). The BBC adaptation of the Cousins' War series stayed very faithful to the books. Definitely one to read if you're interested in this period of history.

Stopped at 51%. Not really keeping my interest at this point. Though, they are a very sweet couple and it's very, very low angst. Maybe that's the problem...no conflict of any type yet. I'll give it try later.

book.title: Her Hacker Dragon: A Dragon Shifter & Vampire Romance (Her Biker Dragon Book 4)

review.body: I received this book for free in return for an honest review. Penelope is being attacked by two dragon shifters when she first meets Alec, the hot, powerful biker dragon. As a vampire, she would have had the strength to fight them had they attacked her at night-time, but lucky for her Alec turns...

Definitely not as good as The Psychopath Test, but I think that's just because the whole book is full of people who so strongly believe in things that I find ridiculous. Jon Ronson is a good author and storyteller, and I'll be reading more of his books in the future!

Good

Dark story, good character development, new to some of the villains in the story. Makes you question what's really going on.

A most unusual book. Who would believe that a girl, desperate for normal (her parents are into obsessive topiary and tiara-making) would find her unique happiness by being adopted by a baby Norwegian glacier named Cecil. The narration, coupled with beautiful, albeit a tad odd, illustrations, work...

I am not sure what to say about this book, except it’s weird. The plot is weird, the characters are weird, their relationships with each other are the weirdest thing of all … but it is a really fascinating read exactly because of its weirdness.

book.title: A Feast for Crows (A Song of Ice and Fire, #4)

review.body: Echoing other reviews I've seen this hasn't been my favourite of the series so far. I understand the need to split up A Feast for Crows and A Dance with Dragons due to length but I don't like how it was done- it feels like all of the least interesting characters have been lumped into one book, wi...
WOW! Couldn't put it down

I was in the mood for another "Rosie Project" or "A Man Called Ove" story and "love in lower case" sounded like it would be suitable, and in some ways it was. But now that I’ve read "Be Frank With Me," lower case has fallen by the wayside and Frank has won the read-alike award. There were parts o...
